text:
Another feature request please...
JMeter doesn't indicate when a test cannot be conducted due to client resource 
constraint issues. For example; when a low spec machine gets so short of memory 
or CPU that a request is not submitted on schedule. In those instances it would 
be helpful to indicate that the client side machine was overloaded and the load 
needs to be relieved.
Even better; if this could be predictive (ie, as you develop your test case, a 
warning is given that the test exceeds the capability of the machine). For 
example "Warning: Your machine is not capable of submitting 10,000,000 
requests/sec reliably."

I don't think that's feasible.

If you know otherwise, please reopen with details, ideally a patch.
